result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reggie Duane Gilbertson

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Reggie Duane Gilbertson in court, Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Reggie Duane Gilbertson. Atty. Erdman requests 1-day JT. Court sets FPT and JT, notes settlement deadline. Adjourned: 9:05 AM. kma
Jury trial scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on January 25, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on February 7, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 6/21/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Duane Gilbertson. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- Defendant may retreive belongings at residence one time in the presence of law enforcement.

01:37 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius and Intern Kaitlin Dippolito, DF:  Reggie Duane Gilbertson appeared from jail. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. State requests bond. Ms. Dippolito makes bond argument. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:41 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
